intro: Lithophila muscoides var. caespitosa, commonly known as the rock moss, is a low-growing plant that thrives in rocky or crevice environments. It belongs to the family Pterobryaceae and is characterized by its dense, cushion-like growth habit. The plant has small, closely spaced leaves that are typically green or yellowish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded areas, such as on cliffs or in rocky soils. Its botanical structure is adapted to retain moisture and withstand harsh environmental conditions.
